website_summaries.verdict: If you want your coffee in a hurry, this feature-rich machine brews up to 25% faster than competitors.
pros: Easy to use and simple to program
Features brew strength selector, adjustable temperature control for the heater plate, and 1- to 4-cup option for smaller brews
Easy-to-fill reservoir with water level indicator
cons: Coffee doesn't come out hot enough for some

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this coffee maker!  It leaks!
customer_reviews.text: We have had a Cuisinart coffee maker for over 10 years. It wore out so we got another one. It leaked. So we thought no big deal, it's defective. So we replaced it with another Cuisinart. And this one leaks. What's going on Cuisinart? We are now inconvenienced with having to replace it yet again. What is going on in your quality control department?
customer_reviews.author: Deborah L. Whitworth

customer_reviews.title: leaks
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a Cuisinart over 5 years ago and loved it. So when it needed to be replaced, I purchased this model thinking it would perform just as well. I am extremely disappointed! The coffee isn't as hot and it leaks up to 3 cups of water every time I use it. I don't know if this particular one is a lemon or if it just isn't manufactured as well as previously. I'm now looking at purchasing another brand.
customer_reviews.author: DT

customer_reviews.title: The brewed coffee is NOT hot, rather only warm ...
customer_reviews.text: The brewed coffee is NOT hot, rather only warm. Also, the coffee grinds end up on the inside of the lid (I think the coffee basket is too close to the lid). Also, I tried to return the item the Cuisinart, and they simply told me to return the item to the seller (Amazon). Since I can't really tell on Amazon the actual seller, I do know to whom I can return the item!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Gallagher

customer_reviews.title: Fails after two or three years required parts not available
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd one of these and they start leaking water out of the bottom after 2 - 3 years. This is from a hose at the bottom that rots from the heat and fails. Replacement parts are not available. DO NOT BUY! You need a T10 star screwdriver to remove the 4 screws from the base of the unit. Once you take off the bottom, you'll see 2 orange hoses. One or both are probably leaking. When I pulled back the hose clamp one of the rubber hoses broke and the other was noticeably cracked.
customer_reviews.author: JC_Dexter

customer_reviews.title: Great Coffee Maker!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little hesitant to purchase this coffee maker after reading the mixed reviews, but I’m SO glad I did! The coffee that comes out of this machine is perfect! It’s important to note that the machine’s heating plate turns off once brewing is complete, but the carafe is insulated. I typically preheat my carafe with hot water first, then brew coffee. When I do this, my coffee will stay hot for at least an hour... Sometimes longer. All being said I would definitely purchase this coffee maker again!
customer_reviews.author: Bryce Burton

customer_reviews.title: I recommend the DCC-2650!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these 9 years ago and it's been my DAILY coffee maker ever since, it’s still working fine but it’s time to replace it since it's showing signs of wear. Best coffee maker I've ever had, after a little research I just bought another one! The price on Amazon is about 28% off the Cuisinart site ($109.95). Before this coffee maker I bought 2 other coffee makers in the 3 years prior. I recommend this Cuisinart coffee make for anyone looking for a dependable, programable, device for a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Julian

customer_reviews.title: DEFECTIVE PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: Had this coffee maker for less than 2 months. This morning it died. The wires were melting inside and the odor was horrible. I called Cuisinart Customer Service - and wad told: ship the unit back at MY expense PLUS $10 and wait 10 days for a replacement. When I asked for a refund, i was told that I would have to write a letter to corporate to request it. This is customer service? At best I would have to wait 10 days for a cup of coffee! I will never by Cuisinart products again.
customer_reviews.author: RSB

customer_reviews.title: 9 years and still going strong. The "1-4 cups" and the "bold" options are awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this coffee maker about 9 years ago and it's still going strong! And it makes good, strong coffee. What more do you want? Perhaps a lower carafe temperature? Because even on the lowest setting, it get super hot and starts to taste burnt only after a little while. We either just drink it all straight away, or pour it into a thermos. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Celia

customer_reviews.title: Dud!  Defective Product that didn't make it 1 year.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't even make it 1 year - no longer works. Worst product. Also, the pause when you grab pot before it's finished has NEVER worked. For the past week it barely makes 1 out of 5 cups - goes to cleaning? and now just stops.
customer_reviews.author: deb

customer_reviews.title: Almost returned it to Amazon
customer_reviews.text: We had a 20-year-old Capresso that we loved. But it died. We thought this was close -- I mean, I don't want to spend $200 on a coffee maker. But this is actually louder than our dishwasher at times during the brew cycle. Anyway, we decided to keep it. It does keep coffee warm.
customer_reviews.author: lockedout

customer_reviews.title: Purchased Feb. 2012.  As of Nov. 2017 and about 2,400 brewing cycles:  Zero problems
customer_reviews.text: Purchased via Amazon February 2012. Used nearly every day for closing in on six years. Zero problems. Brews at high temp (a couple times was at 190F which I was concerned was too high). I like temperature setting for maintaining carafe temperature kept low as while super hot coffee is wonderful for a great brew, drinking it is preferred around 120F. Been very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Sir Tools Alot

customer_reviews.title: Quality Control and lifespan  Not so Good Anymore?
customer_reviews.text: We have used Cuisinart coffee makers circa 2000 and have loved all aspects of them (as reflected in the features ratings). Our last machine broke down after 3 1/2 years in use (the warranty is three years). The predecessors had all lasted six or seven. Nonetheless, we ordered a replacement which was shipped with misaligned control panel trim (see photo) and a defective basket assembly and returned (hence, the overall "2" rating). We're keeping our fingers crossed the second replacement machine --which arrived in great shape-- can rebound to its all-star days.
customer_reviews.author: JRN

customer_reviews.title: VAST improvement over previous cheaper Cuisinart models I've had
customer_reviews.text: This is DIVINE. Over the years i've had the DCC1200, then the DCC1100, both of which had lousy pour spouts leading to junky hot plate in due course. This one has PERFECT pour spout that drips nothing, MUCH improved flavor and totally reliable drip-stop mechanism. (The others were quite erratic in this behavior.) It shuts off when its supposed to. Even the regular flavor setting brews far superior coffee to the prior models. Well worth a few more dollars.
customer_reviews.author: fern

customer_reviews.title: Hot coffee
customer_reviews.text: This looks good on my counter since my other appliances are also brushed stainless. The coffee brews quickly and is good and hot. Best of all, the carafe pours without spilling. We've had trouble pouring from other coffee pots because they tend to dribble around the spout - this one doesn't. The controls for programming take a minute to figure out, but directions are included and simple to follow.
customer_reviews.author: Shari R. Kumer

customer_reviews.title: One of the best coffee pots I’ve owned. Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This coffee pot makes an excellent cup of coffee. Only downfall is over time it tends to leak from where it brews. I overlook it because it makes such a great tasting cup of Joe. This is my second pot. I get a good 3 years or so use out of it, brewing 2 to 3 pots a day 7 days a week. Definitely a very durable coffee maker. I will be buying it again as long as they make it.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with this coffeemaker! Not only is the coffee it makes "smooth", with the side window I just take the hose from the faucet and fill to desired level and click on. No filling the pot first, then pouring it in the coffee maker second...totally saves those steps making it more efficient in the mornings. Love the retro-esc styling as well!
customer_reviews.author: Jan Sharp

customer_reviews.title: Makes good coffee. If you put more than 15 tablespoons ...
customer_reviews.text: Makes good coffee. If you put more than 15 tablespoons of ground coffee into it, it overflows the filter and you get grounds in your coffee. So if you like, as we do, to use about 2 tablespoons per cup of coffee, you can't make more than 8 or 9 cups. Less that that, if you use the gold filter that comes with it. Otherwise it's good.
customer_reviews.author: ARM

customer_reviews.title: SKIP THIS ONE! Previous quality has hit bottom
customer_reviews.text: Had two before this one and they both lasted 5 and 6 years. Four months in, the timer/beeper is bonkers; the timer goes off either halfway through brewing or not at all. The cleaning -needed light came on and during cleaning it shut itself off after five minutes and wouldn't empty the vinegar solution until I ran it on regular brew. Not recommended at all. Update: I got the thing to work for a couple more months by setting in on 1-4 cups, "bold" but when it took half an hour to make a pot of 10 cups this morning, ordered a Ninja brand to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: NT

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: 2 years later and working great, although I’m mostly a weekend coffee drinker. I usually go for the thermal carafes because I don’t like having my coffee sit on a hot pad for awhile and I like bringing the pot to the table. I also like that the water goes in to the filter from the top center, so it never folds down the filter and makes a mess. A couple of eh features that I can live with, loads from the top so it needs to get pulled out from under cupboard to use and the hot pad is on even though this is a thermal carafe so I use a trivet to keep it off the table.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny K

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: Wife is the coffee drinker and she says this coffee maker is exactly what she wanted. Had it almost 2 months and it works great! No complaints. The optional "Ready Tone" feature isn't loud or annoying at all. Gets our dog's attention, but wife says she can barely hear it sometimes. Then again, she's also usually busy when it goes off. LOL Very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Allums-Realtor

customer_reviews.title: Fast and good taste - poor quality control - good customer service
customer_reviews.text: Fast brewing without a lot of flavor sacrifice. Hard to read the water fill line. Have owned may Cuisinart coffee makers and all make great coffee but come at the expense of reliability. so far the customer service has stood behind the product, which you will likely need; albeit I have not heard anyone who has this kind of flavor and features and not experience technical issues at some point in three years of use.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: I really like this coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: I really like this coffee maker. It's very easy to use and keeps my coffee very hot. There are different levels for how hot you want your coffee to keep while in the pot. The only issue I have is the cover to the pot is very difficult to keep it shut tightly. I can never snap it shut where I feel it won't fall off when I pour a cup. I always keep my hand on the cover while pouring for fear it may fall off. It did once and spilled the coffee on my counter. I wish I knew how to keep the cover on tightly. Other than that it's great.
customer_reviews.author: J. Tague

customer_reviews.title: Better than ever.
customer_reviews.text: This the 3rd Cuisinart coffee maker over the last 15 years. It's the same model, but much improved. The lid is better made and opens and closes easily. The opening for filling with water is larger and therefore easier to fill and less mess. The controls and display are easier to read. Still makes the best coffee.
customer_reviews.author: A. J. Friedrich

customer_reviews.title: Coffee isn't hot enough
customer_reviews.text: I have owned Cuisinart coffee makers in the past that made very hot coffee. Maybe I got a defective one, but this one only brewed to 160 degrees. I returned it and bought the Motif, which brews very hot!
customer_reviews.author: PFraserTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Good overall coffee machine/pot
customer_reviews.text: It’s well priced and it works fine. We like having the SS pot. We sometimes forget to look for leftover coffee in the pot before brewing another pot! Just getting used to a non-glass pot. It’s a bit awkward pouring water in the top. We also forgot to put the pot in the base once prior to brewing, and it proceeded to brew all over our counter 😯 - we are not that old 😉 Overall it’s a good general coffee machine.
customer_reviews.author: ML

customer_reviews.title: This is the one!
customer_reviews.text: We finally had to put our old Cuisinart with a bean grinder to rest; it served us well for many years. It was a challenge to figure out what we would buy for our replacement out of the Cuisinart line. THIS IS PERFECT! We picked wisely. I like that we can program the length of time the warmer stays on and this is a very trim unit and fits nicely in the kitchen without taking over the counter. Numerous items we can rave about however, the steam vent is at the back which you will want to be aware of when brewing under a cabinet. Cuisinart makes the best coffee brewers....would not buy another brand!
customer_reviews.author: MLF

customer_reviews.title: Not very happy 👎
customer_reviews.text: If you like"hot" coffee, this unit will Not deliver. Also coffee cools down fast in poorly insulated kraft. Have been experimenting on amount of coffee needed, takes a full scope more than old maker. Not very happy 👎
customer_reviews.author: Tom Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee maker for the price
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for the same coffee maker that lasted about 15 years. We like the ability to do a 'bold' brew and be able to adjust the temperature of the warmer plate. The design makes it easy to use and the coffee tastes great.
customer_reviews.author: Abby

customer_reviews.title: This coffee maker has all the bells and whistles and ...
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker has all the bells and whistles and generally functions well. However, it has a hot plate. The whole purpose of having a thermal carafe is to get the coffee off a hot plate. According to America's Test Kitchen, coffee burns in 3 minutes. It's an unfortunate feature.
customer_reviews.author: William J Capecchi

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart DCC-2650 coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: After publishing my first review of the DCC-2650 coffee maker, I was told by a great viewer to look in the manual and my disappointment was totally changed to I love this coffee maker. I had done something I never do, which was not to read the owner's manual first. After reading it I found the auto-off button and now my coffee maker can stay on for up to4 hours which settles my disappointment. It really is a wonderful machine and all that I expect from Cuisinart.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce Lichtenfels

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee from a great coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: Great coffee from a nicely designed and easy to use machine. I like the temperature settings for the brewed coffee. My previous coffee maker did not have this feature. The coffee could only be brewed at one temperature - it always tasted burned and yet the drinking temperature was not as hot as I like it. The Cuisinart can make coffee that is just this side of boiling hot lava and yet it still tastes remarkable - no scorching! It may not be as pretty as some others but...if you're looking for good coffee and ease of use this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Troia

customer_reviews.title: This isn't fun to clean up while still holding onto the hot ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing makes hot coffee very quickly. I have no problem with its capabilities. However, it's louder than my old coffee maker (gurgles more), and somehow water gets underneath the filter basket. This means that when I remove the carafe to pour a cup, it jostles the machine and filter basket just enough so that the water starts leaking down onto the hot plate. This isn't fun to clean up while still holding onto the hot carafe. I wouldn't buy it again, if I knew this would happen again.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Porter

customer_reviews.title: Off to a great start ... ended with steam and splutter.
customer_reviews.text: At first, it was excellent. Delicious coffee! Now, a couple of months into regular morning use, it splutters and there is excessive steam out of the top back. So disappointing. We have always used Cuisinart.
customer_reviews.author: Hambone

customer_reviews.title: Makes great coffe!
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker replaced a similar Cuisinart model that I had for about 15 years. It makes nice hot coffee that stays hot in the carafe longer than my insulated coffee mug. I like the bold brew feature since I like my coffee strong. I haven't used the water filter since I use filtered water to make my coffee anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Gima

customer_reviews.title: Not as "thermal" as I expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thermal carafe version of the Cuisinart coffee pot in hopes that the coffee would stay hot and fresh for several hours after brewing. I found this not to be the case. The pot makes great coffee, but after the first hour or so, every cup I pour needs to be heated up in the microwave to be drinkable. Not at all convenient. If good tasting, hot coffee is a priority for you, you're better purchasing a single-cup brewer -- which is what I have done.
customer_reviews.author: C. Finnesgard

customer_reviews.title: I love the look of the coffee maker but very disappointed ...
customer_reviews.text: I love the look of the coffee maker but very disappointed in that it does not get very hot. I have had different Cuisinart Thermal Coffeemakers before and they were great. This one disappoints me greatly. Other features on the extreme brew is great, just not hot enough.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's just OK. For an "extreme brew, " ...
customer_reviews.text: It's just OK. For an "extreme brew," it sure takes a long time to brew even a single cup. For all the tag lines in the description, coffee is not very hot. I often find myself having to warm up my tablespoon or two of milk in the microwave so it won't make the whole cup of coffee cold. Not impressed, would look elsewhere. In summary, takes a long time to brew lukewarm coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Fremed

customer_reviews.title: Not the quality I was expecting
customer_reviews.text: The carafe is very poorly designed. If tipped too much it leaks, yet it must be almost totally inverted to pour the last cups. When the maker is moved on my counter top it leaves mars which must be removed with a cleaner. The alarm, not that I'd use it, doesn't work. I do like the two brew options. Would I buy again? Probably not.
customer_reviews.author: Fxdllion

customer_reviews.title: but more importantly it also makes a fantastic cup of coffee
customer_reviews.text: I have the last model design where the reservoir opening was too small and it was common to have some of the water spilling over the counter as I filled the reservoir. This purchase was worth not having to deal with that annoyance, but more importantly it also makes a fantastic cup of coffee. I watch "Good Eats" with Alton Brown, who highly recommended using the gold/copper colored basket that comes with the coffee maker instead of regular filters (I have always used the paper filters out of habit only). I do and he was right about the better taste in coffee. Besides, I never have to worry about having paper filters at the ready. I love this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Nora Carlson

customer_reviews.title: The previous model was more simple to use but it's great anyway
customer_reviews.text: Cuisinart is still by far the best of these things, the previous version with the dip switches up front was simpler. We have had this for three months and I still manage to accidentally put it into cleaning mode or 4 cup mode. If you need glasses to read fine print this is not the best for you. The best improvement is the side float that tells you how much water is in the machine. The not so great thing is that the measurements are a cup off from the lines on the carafe. 8 cups on the carafe is 7 cups in the machine. Peculiar.
customer_reviews.author: Simone Ollen

customer_reviews.title: Damaged underside of cabinets
customer_reviews.text: We had an older 14 cup same model of this product & ordered a 12 cup version for another location. There is about 5-6" to the underside of my cabinets and after 2 months the underside has been damaged from the steam that comes out of the top of the unit. Our 14 cup model never did this & after 2 years of use we had no damage to the cabinets. After 2 months I am hoping Amazon or Cuisinart will do something about it. Other than that, we love this coffee maker but make sure you have a completely open area above for the steam or risk damage to your cabinets!
customer_reviews.author: Debi

customer_reviews.title: not my best choice
customer_reviews.text: Top of the coffee maker gets very hot after coffee is made. You can set the clock but there's no light so you can't read it. There's a lot of steam that fogs the settings on the front of the coffee maker. Not my best choice......
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: instead of staying on for an hour like the glass carafe version
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my office to replace an old Cuisinart Extreme Brew with the glass carafe. I thought the thermal carafe would keep the coffee hot longer and allow us to finish the pot later in the day... nope. The hot plate turns off after brewing finishes, instead of staying on for an hour like the glass carafe version. The glass carafe stayed hot longer than the thermal because of this. It's also more difficult to fill with water (since you can't really see what's going on inside) and we can't tell how much is left unless we open it up. I didn't think about these things but overall it's a bigger pain than the regular glass carafe.
customer_reviews.author: kckevinwhite

customer_reviews.title: Just as BAD as reviewed
customer_reviews.text: Surely Cuisinart can't make a coffee maker that is as bad as reviewed, right? Not hot. Not flavorful. Carafe that won't hold temp . . . Well yes they can! READ and LISTEN to all the BAD reviews. Having attempted several pots and even purchasing an additional carafe to carry the different types of coffee we brew, I can attest to coffee that is not hot, tastes worse than gas station coffee and the carafe won't hold heat. The Hamilton Beach coffee maker from the attic makes far better coffee than the Cuisinart and it's hot! DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS PRODUCT!!
customer_reviews.author: John Sowell

customer_reviews.title: It's just fine.
customer_reviews.text: You can choose whether you want regular or bold brew, by pressing a button. These two buttons are off center, but they work, so aesthetically I find it unattractive. This pot keeps the coffee hot, I appreciate the transparent bar on the side where I can see the water level. I've had no issues with dripping or leaking. The pot beeps when the coffee is ready and when the pot is turning off. Overall, it's a coffee pot, it makes coffee.
customer_reviews.author: nce

customer_reviews.title: Noisy, coffee not not
customer_reviews.text: This was the third Cuisinart coffee maker I have owned, and was bad from the start. The coffee maker made loud noises trying to force the water out of the reservoir from start to finish. Coffee was not hot and did not have a hot brew taste. After about an hour, coffee in pot was only warm. A big disappointment
customer_reviews.author: C. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: In less than a year the auto program feature stopped working, in a 10 months the auto stop stopped working, and now a couple weeks over a year it just dribbles everywhere. I wouldn't purchase this item again. Very poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: Olga

customer_reviews.title: Bought this for my parents and they love it! They love that they can program it ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my parents and they love it! They love that they can program it to start making coffee at 6:00 am when they wake up. Very neat feature
customer_reviews.author: aboeck07

customer_reviews.title: So much better than less expensive brands
customer_reviews.text: Great coffee maker. Have one at home for a few years and really like it. We recently bought a weekend place and needed a coffee maker. I went with a less pricey brand - took it back. I did this 3 times with cheaper brands and finally decided they just were all junk. So back to the Cuisinart. It is worth the extra money. Great coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: Jean M.

customer_reviews.title: Working great for four years
customer_reviews.text: Four years later and with (at least once) daily use this is working great. I have had no issues with leakage and it brews a strong coffee. I use a coffee pot cleaner every 2-3 months and the machine continues to operate flawlessly. I noted that this is now about $30 cheaper than when I bought it, so it seems an even better buy. I have been using the following settings to ensure that the coffee is strong enough for my taste: 1. "Bold" setting, and 2. 1-4 cup setting (even if I brew a full carafe)
customer_reviews.author: Veniero

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this coffee maker. I got it for my birthday last August, and I'm a pretty big coffee snob. I worked at a coffee shop for years and love coffee. I had a keurig but hated the way the coffee tasted and that I couldn't use premium coffee in it, but I also am usually in a hurry and didn't want to take the time for a pour over or french press so I thought I'd give this a try. I Iike it because the coffee still has a great taste but I can get it fast without any clean up and I really like the monogramming options
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's Average
customer_reviews.text: A good coffee maker but not outstanding. The ready alarm is very low so it's very difficult to hear and the carafe temperature does not produce restaurant hot coffee. If you purchase a much less expensive brand you will likely end up with the same quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Digoldy

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee maker we have had !
customer_reviews.text: Best coffee maker we have had. We have used Bunn coffee makers for years and they too are good, but seem to last about five years. The flavor from this coffee maker seems a lot better with many different settings and a timer. Would highly recommend this coffee maker. Looks great too.
customer_reviews.author: thelaw6pointstarwi

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: There are less parts to clean with this Cuisinart (last one was a Grind n' Brew). No longer grind my own coffee beans so am loving less clean-up/mess! It was very easy to program--great step-by-stop instruction booklet.
customer_reviews.author: PLD

customer_reviews.title: Worth the buy!!
customer_reviews.text: Great Coffee maker i hade this same one for years and it broke down on me. So I ordered the same one because I liked it so much. Easy to use and love the auto brew with timer. Would highly recommend this coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in this Cuisinart coffee maker and returned it
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this Cuisinart coffee maker and returned it. It leaked from the top, slow to make coffee and the clean light came on with first use. Could never get it to stay off even after following the directions.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Leaks when water reservoir is filled.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this machine when our other one quit working after 7+ years. This machine looks great and seemed to worked fine for a little over a year. We typically have only brewed 6-8 cups at a time. I was on vacation and brewed a few full 12cups and the water resovoir leaks all over when filled. Others have mentioned a seam above the 8 cup level and hat appears to be our issue as well. Very disappointing guess we’ll ook at another brand to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: David Brence

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee
customer_reviews.text: Love this Cuisinart. This is our second one. We make several pots of coffee every day and this coffee maker always does a great job. I like all the settings for brew strength, temperature of coffee and clock settings. I would recommend Cuisinart coffee maker to anyone wanting a good quality machine and a great cup of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Brin

customer_reviews.title: Makes a good pot of coffee
customer_reviews.text: I like the timer feature; necessary for those of us that wake up at 4:45am for work. Thinking is not possible at this ungodly hour so the coffee does the thinking for you. Change the filter regularly and you'll be happy with the maker. Hey, it's a Cuisinart.
customer_reviews.author: David H. Tremper

customer_reviews.title: expensive disappointment.
customer_reviews.text: Even on the highest setting, coffee does not stay hot enough. Coffeemaker beeps to indicate that coffee is finished being brewed, but coffee continues to drip out onto the hotplate when carafe is removed to pour. Feature that is supposed to prevent dripping does not function. Overall, expensive disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: kathy

customer_reviews.title: Not All That
customer_reviews.text: I really dislike this machine. After reading many reviews I selected this coffeemaker despite a few negative comments regarding the carafe. The carafe is horrible! It is awkward, has to be turned almost upside down to get a pour for smaller brew amounts. It does not keep the coffee hot for very long. I also did not think the coffee flavor was exceptional as promised.
customer_reviews.author: Picky Reader

customer_reviews.title: Cold coffee after one cup!
customer_reviews.text: Cumbersome carafe - We thought the carafe was supposed to keep the coffee warm for a bit... Well enjoy one hot cup of java as afterwards it lukewarm at best. Total waste of $129.95!
customer_reviews.author: Southern NH Consumer

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE This Coffee Maker
customer_reviews.text: Cuisinart coffee makers are worth every penny. My last Cuisinart brewer lasted 20 years. This system is programmable, so coffee is ready when you wake up...and delicious. You can program it regular or strong. So step away from the Keurig! They are too much effort for a single cup of coffee, and too costly to maintain. Buy this Cuisinart. It will not disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: Miminana

customer_reviews.title: Happy to own this
customer_reviews.text: Since I'm such a big coffee drinker, I decided it was time to upgrade to a decent coffee machine and get rid of the old $20 pot. I'm glad I did. I love this coffee machine. It's incredibly easy to set up, comprehend, clean, and use. It brews quickly. My one complaint is that it bothers me that it beeps when the pot is done brewing. I just think it is pointless. I don't need an alarm to tell me when it is done brewing. This thing was worth the small bit of extra money. I would've paid more for it but I'm glad I didn't have to.
customer_reviews.author: Hourglass Cat

customer_reviews.title: The best!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this beautiful, hot coffee pot. I can count on it. No problems at all. It’s on all day, and my last one lasted 6 1/2 years.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy

customer_reviews.title: Drips and leaks
customer_reviews.text: Cuisinart quality has really gone down. Coffee more than drips down after you pull pot out. Thermos leaks out every time we pour. Had this for 6 months and we're tired of cleaning up the messes! Will buy a different maker but not sure what to get. Why is it you can't find good ratings for a coffee maker?
customer_reviews.author: K. Booth

customer_reviews.title: Superb Coffeemaker!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this coffee pot a year ago and still love it. It has all the features that were important to me- bold brew, signal when it is done, automatic shut off, and easy to clean. The most important requirement is a good cup of coffee and this model delivers that. I have not been disappointed. The glass carafe is sturdier than a lot of the other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Nursey

customer_reviews.title: Great Coffee Maker!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy coffee maker to keep clean and, program. We had this same coffee maker for many years before it went out. Happy we were able to find the exact one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t last me even 2 years :(
customer_reviews.text: I enjoyed this coffee maker, but unfortunately, it didn’t last us even two years! It sat in a box for about six months prior to even using it, because I bought it in advance. Hard to recommend a product that didn’t last me long.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simple operation and great coffee.
customer_reviews.text: Great coffee brewer. Easy to clean and use. Makes great coffee. Brews quickly and quitely. Not complicated. Nice appearance. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Dorie

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: Great quality with this brand - my last Cuisinart coffee maker lasted about 10 years; I expect this one to be as good a value as well.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth H.

customer_reviews.title: I have nothing but trouble with this coffeemaker
customer_reviews.text: I loved my old Cuisinart, which is why I chose this one. I thought I'd get used to it, but it has overflowed too many times. I make sure the carafe is securely in place; I make sure the grounds container is securely in place, yet unless I watch each time, chances are, the coffee will not drip into the carafe and I'll have a mess on my counters and with the location of the water well, grounds in the clean water as well. I have finally eliminated using it altogether and will look for a new system. I'd also have a hard time choosing Cuisinart again.
customer_reviews.author: MaryD

customer_reviews.title: My first one is 10 years old and still works great (I took it to my camper at the lake)
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Cuisinart coffee maker. My first one is 10 years old and still works great (I took it to my camper at the lake). I wanted this new one because I liked the stainless carafe’ and a relative of mine has one like it. It works great and the coffee stays hot for many hours.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Kane Hearndon

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart DCC 2750 Extreme Brew 10 cup thermal programmable coffeemaker
customer_reviews.text: I researched for several months before selecting this coffeemaker. 10 cups is plenty for most households. The coffeemaker lives up to it's adverstisement. I like the easy instructions, ability to turn off beeping nodes, the 1-4 cup availability, the easy pour pot, thermal capability and other choices. Coffee remains fairly hot for hours. I do not use the additional filter as I have a great water source where I live. I use medium to fine grind coffee and prefer a paper filter in the mesh filter provided for easier clean-up.
customer_reviews.author: In to comfort and ease

customer_reviews.title: nice after slow start...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item for my wife and when she first saw it she was a bit overwhelmed by it's apparent complexity...we had a simple Mr.Coffee maker previously and this item seem a bit daunting to her ...it sat on the counter for a couple of weeks before she managed to finally"program" it and now she is quite satisfied with the results...I purchased this overly lavish item to match the stainless appliances in our newly refinished kitchen and in the end it is fine although perhaps a bit more than she wanted...
customer_reviews.author: scout44

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this machine
customer_reviews.text: I use hot water to fill the reservoir and the coffee still is not that hot. Difficult to pour water in the reservoir. Basket drips after carafe is removed during brewing. Also in the brewing process sometimes it doesn't use all of the water in the reservoir and I have to push the on button again to use up the water. Not happy with this machine and will be looking for a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: D Y

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: This machine is hard to add the necessary water to make a full pot of coffee. It leaked out every where on the table. Did not stay hot 4 hours either. We highly do not recommend it. Also purchase it somewhere else if you must it has been 9 days and still no refund.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Coffee Maker!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in 2013 and now it's 2015 and it's still in daily use! I liked it so much I bought another for my parents as a gift when their coffee machine died and they have enjoyed it as well. It's sleek and clean and it's basic with some nice extra functions as well. I am a coffee lover and I have other kinds of ways to brew coffee like a french press, a Keurig B60 and a Bialetti stovetop espresso maker and I by far use this one the most.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Maniez

customer_reviews.title: Great drip brewer.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this excellent brewer. I have used a Kruege for years and have went through several of them due to hard water despite using softened purchased water they still wear out early. So back to the drip brew and I am pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with the new styling
customer_reviews.text: Pleased with the new styling. I appreciate the wider lid opening. Now when adding water it doesn't drip all over the place anymore. So much better to see the water level from the outside window vrs looking down into the coffee maker, especially in low lighting. Suggest making the clock/program time illuminated then it would be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Leaked Out of Box from Amazon Warehouse Deals
customer_reviews.text: When I purchased this item it was listed as "like new" and the approval rating for Warehouse Deals was 93%. Unfortunately the unit I received leaked the very first time I used it. I wish there was more effective quality control. I like the design and the lid has a quality feel to it. The warming plate for the carafe got really hot which was great. There are 3 settings for this. Very impressive look and I couldn't tell from looking at it that it was plastic instead of stainless steel. I went ahead and ordered another one from Warehouse Deals. Hopefully I'll have better luck this time.
customer_reviews.author: Downtown Reader

customer_reviews.title: Attractive and Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: The product came extremely well packaged. I use it every morning. It's attractive and easy to use. The settings give me all the options I need. The only issue is the filling port. It's in the back on the side, and not particularly easy to fill without spilling water. Otherwise, I'm pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to the Keurig for better coffee, cheaper
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. It makes great coffee and IT SAVES ME SO MUCH MONEY! I hope people realize how much they are spending on K-cups and how bad the coffee actually tastes. With the money I save, we have upgraded to small batches of fresh ground coffee, and the difference is tremendous. This pot is a workhorse. My only minor complaint is that if I pour too fast the lid on the pot leaks.
customer_reviews.author: LindyLise

customer_reviews.title: Reliable. Good taste.
customer_reviews.text: Love this machine. We had our last one for about 5 years. Makes a great, reliable pot of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Spalla and Danelle  Spalla

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee pot!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great coffee pot. I have not tried this brand before but am very pleased. It has a setting to make 1-4 cups which is great when my husband wants a cup of coffee in the evening. It also has a timer which I haven't tried yet. I ordered the replacement filters also since our water isn't the greatest.
customer_reviews.author: CVineyard

customer_reviews.title: Surprised, as I have used Cuisinart for several years ...
customer_reviews.text: Surprised, as I have used Cuisinart for several years -- did not allow pause during brew, even got new basket thinking that was defective, still coffee all over. Had to go through the hassle of returning.
customer_reviews.author: Julie I. Boertje

customer_reviews.title: Pretty happy
customer_reviews.text: I like the coffee it makes. It sometimes dribbles when pouring into a cup, so you have to be a bit careful. But overall, it is a great coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Shuts off after only 1 hour
customer_reviews.text: So far I love this coffee maker. Except that it turns off after only an hour. All the ones have had in the past shut off after 2hours. I need to keep the coffee warm at least that long in the mornings. This is the only reason it didn’t get four stars from me.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Northup

customer_reviews.title: Delicious Coffee
customer_reviews.text: love the taste of the coffee this machine brews. I do find it just a bit slower than my previous one (another brand). Since I am left handed it is a bit awkward to fill the reservoir since it is on the right. Not a terrible inconvenience though.
customer_reviews.author: Suri J

customer_reviews.title: Does not make hot coffee
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't make coffee hot and therefore doesn't keep it hot either
customer_reviews.author: KIM C

customer_reviews.title: Love this coffeemaker!
customer_reviews.text: My Aunt had this coffeemaker and I could not believe how hot the coffee stayed. Had to have it for myself and I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: I am very displeased with the quality of this coffee pot. It will not make coffee with the water filter inserted. It will brew maybe 1 cup, then it will beep signalling the end of the cycle. With the water filter taken out, it brews coffee , but very, very slowly. The coffee comes out very strong because of this. It is obviously defective, I will not be ordering a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse & Christy

customer_reviews.title: Incorrect product description
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker was suppose to have a 0 - 4 hour timer for the heat plate. It does not. I contacted Cuisinart customer service, the rep tried to help figure out if the function was in the coffee maker, it is not. Cuisinart customer service did a fine job. A supervisor recommended sending the unit back.
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: Programmable feature did not work. Cuisinart says no diagnostics - just return it. Truly, who needs this aggravation?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Has worked for many years
customer_reviews.text: The location for filling is somewhat small, in the right corner. Other than that it continues to produce good coffee results.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Miiller

customer_reviews.title: Same defect, only crops up much sooner!
customer_reviews.text: I owned an earlier version of this coffee maker, and overall it functions well for coffee, looks good, etc...but the clock setting function stopped working after a few years. I could program it, but it made setting an auto on time a "math problem". So you can imagine my dismay that the new machine, while functioning better in every way, broke 2 mo after purchase. The problem? I CAN'T SET THE DAMN CLOCK! Like seriously Cuisinart, what's up with that function?
customer_reviews.author: C. Harnish

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and clean
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and clean; makes great coffee, keeps it nice and hot without burning. For some reason clear water that has not gone through the filter basket leaks down to the warming plate when the carafe is removed to pour the coffee. Not big deal, but where's it coming from?
customer_reviews.author: Jo-Ann Harkow

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: Works good but NO light behind clock / timer .... description did NOT state clearly
customer_reviews.author: ElectricArt

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this coffee maker less than a year ago and it already does not work properly. It takes FOREVER for the coffee to drip through, I have cleaned it several times and NOTHING fixes it, it has been a waste of money!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bridget C.

customer_reviews.title: Just doesn't make good coffee.
customer_reviews.text: We gave this coffee maker three tries. We used quality, freshly ground coffee beans, and we tried the coffee maker with the permanent gold tone filter, with a regular paper filter, and with both together. We tried both the Regular and the Bold setting. The coffee just didn't taste good! Our previous $50 Mr. Coffee coffee maker made much better coffee!
customer_reviews.author: B Walk

product_meta.title: Cuisinart DCC-2650 Brew Central 12-Cup Programmable Coffeemaker
product_meta.description:
Style Name:Glass| Size:12-CupCuisinart brews coffee that keeps up with mornings that fly by. Our Extreme Brew technology delivers coffee 25% faster for a more efficient, more relaxed morning routine. Take control of your blend's strength, choosing from regular or bold, and set your brew up to 24 hours in advance for on-demand cafe service.

BRAND STORY
By Cuisinart
feature_bullets: 12-cup carafe with ergonomic handle, dripless spout and knuckle guard
Fully automatic with 24-hour programmability, self-clean, 1-4 cup setting and adjustable auto-shutoff (0-4 hours)
Adjustable carafe temperature control with high, medium & low settings;BPA (Bisphenol A) Free
Brew Pause feature lets you enjoy a cup of coffee before brewing is completed
Gold tone commercial style permanent filter, Charcoal water filter (removes impurities)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars1,677 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
